question: Is Workers' Compensation required for business owners?
answer:
Generally business owners, and corporate officers, are exempt from mandatory coverage of Workers’ Compensation; however, there are options for those who would like to elect for coverage from the Department of Labor & Industries.

For Corporations, visit: https://lni.wa.gov/insurance/insurance-requirements/do-i-need-a-workers-comp-account/corporate-officers#non-public-corporations


For Limited Liability Companies, visit: https://lni.wa.gov/insurance/insurance-requirements/do-i-need-a-workers-comp-account/llc-members


For Business Owner coverage, visit: https://lni.wa.gov/insurance/insurance-requirements/how-to-get-a-workers-compensation-account/#owner-officer-and-exempt-employments-coverage

If you have additional questions on Workers’ Compensation, contact the Department of Labor & Industries, Employer Services at 360-902-4817.
